entry.title: - SALES EVENT - Porterhouse Steak 20 oz AAA
entry.summary:
Vendor: Slipacoff's Premium Meats
Type: Steak
Price: 25.00

An amazing 20 oz Porterhouse from Canadian-raised AAA beef. This masterpiece of a cut is the first slice of our 35 day aged short loins. 

Divided by a T bone on one side you get Tenderloin and the other side the Striploin. This piece is for major league but easy for anyone to enjoy.

This will bring to you the best of both worlds. This piece will make any meat lover salivate and want to share this cut and live the moment with family or friends

Grilled on the BBQ, indirect heat, cast iron seared or sous-vide.

  • 100% AAA Canadian short loin
  • Naturally raised
  • Free from hormones and antibiotics

The best of the best, our Japanese Wagyu striploin are rated “A5,” the highest possible rating given to beef in Japan. What does that mean for you? Intense intramuscular marbling that melts while your steak cooks. Deep, rich red color. Tenderness and flavor that simply cannot be matched.

A5 Japanese Kobe Striploin steak.  Imported Directly from Japan.

 Beware, Highly addictive

  • 100% A5 Japanese wagyu beef

entry.title: Flat Iron Steak AAA (Asian ginger honey glazed)
entry.summary:
Vendor: Slipacoff's Premium Meats
Type: beef
Price: 8.95

This item is ready to be cooked on the grill or Sous-Vide (Thermocirculator)

Regular cooking:

Sear in a hot frying pan for 2 minutes on each side. Leave to rest for 2 minutes before cutting.

 

Cooking with thermocirculator (Sous-vide)

30 minutes at 133°F in the thermocirculator. Sear in a very hot frying pan for 10 seconds on each side

A bit of Knowledge about sous-vide

Sous vide (pronounced “soo veed”) is a method of cooking that relies on precision temperature control to create the perfect doneness every time. When it comes to cooking steak, cooking sous vide is a game-changer. Cooking sous vide helps ensure that your meat is cooked to a safe temperature without ever overcooking. 

 

Slipacoff's Premium Meats is proud to introduce to all its clientele our NEW Signature line of Sous-Vide ready meats. Developed by our own Executive Chef, we have come up with the perfect recipe for you and your family to enjoy without all the hassles and fusses about looking to find the right recipe for you.

 

AAA Flat Iron steak "Sushi" steak for its popularity in the Asian cuisine.  (Sous-Vide)

You are now ready to serve in your own home what you would order in a High-end steakhouses for a fraction of the cost. 

  • 100% AAA Canadian beef  flat iron steak
  • Naturally raised
  • Free from hormones and antibiotics

 Ingredients:

  • AAA 5 oz flat-iron steak
  • Soy sauce
  • Vegetable oil
  • Minced garlic chopped
  • Black pepper
  • Honey
  • Cayenne
  • Minced ginger 

 

A bit of Knowledge about sous-vide

Sous vide (pronounced “soo veed”) is a method of cooking that relies on precision temperature control to create the perfect doneness every time. When it comes to cooking steak, cooking sous vide is a game-changer. Cooking sous vide helps ensure that your meat is cooked to a safe temperature without ever overcooking. 

 

  Regular cooking:

Sear in a hot frying pan for 2 minutes on each side. Leave to rest for 2 minutes before cutting.

 

Cooking with thermocirculator (Sous-vide)

30 minutes at 135F in the thermocirculator. Sear in a very hot frying pan for 10 seconds on each side.

 

Sous vide, which means “under vacuum” in French, refers to the process of vacuum-sealing food in a bag, then cooking it to a very precise temperature in a water bath. This technique produces results that are impossible to achieve through any other cooking method.

Sous vide cooking is much easier than you might think, and usually involved three simple steps:

1. Attach your precision cooker to a pot of water and set the time and temperature according to your desired level of doneness.

2. Put your food in a sealable bag and clip it to the side of the pot.

3. Finish by searing, grilling, or broiling the food to add a crispy, golden exterior layer.

Sous vide cooking utilizes precise temperature control with circulation to produce results that you can’t achieve through any other cooking technique. The reason–when using traditional methods of cooking, you don’t have control over heat and temperature. Consequently, it’s very difficult and time consuming to consistently cook great food. Food ends up overcooked on the outside, with only a small portion in the center that is cooked to the temperature you want. Food loses flavor, overcooks easily, and ends up with a dry, chewy texture.

With precise temperature control in the kitchen, sous vide provides the following benefits:

Consistency. Because you cook your food to a precise temperature for a precise amount of time, you can expect very consistent results.

Taste. Food cooks in its juices. This ensures that the food is moist, juicy and tender.

Waste reduction. Traditionally prepared food dries out and results in waste. For example, on average, traditionally cooked steak loses up to 40% of its volume due to drying out. Steak cooked via precision cooking, loses none of its volume.

Flexibility. Traditional cooking can require your constant attention. Precision cooking brings food to an exact temperature and holds it. There is no worry about overcooking.

entry.title: - SALES EVENT - Striploin Steak AAA 10 oz ($9 each)
entry.summary:
Vendor: Slipacoff's Premium Meats
Type: Steak
Price: 9.00

One of our most popular cuts, The Striploin Steak is hand-selected AAA graded beef. We age our Striploins for more than 35 days.

Also know as New York Strip, this cut from the loin is one of the three most popular and flavorful steaks you can buy, alongside tenderloin and ribeye. Striploin doesn't have the fat content you might find in a rib steak or ribeye, so if you are looking for something on the leaner side, but still a premium cut of beef, this cut is the way to go.

We recommend the grill or cast iron searing for best results. Simple and easy !

 

  • 100% AAA Canadian beef 
  • Local & Naturally raised
  • Free from hormones and antibiotics

A bit of Knowledge about sous-vide

Sous vide (pronounced “soo veed”) is a method of cooking that relies on precision temperature control to create the perfect doneness every time. When it comes to cooking steak, cooking sous vide is a game-changer. Cooking sous vide helps ensure that your meat is cooked to a safe temperature without ever overcooking. 


Sous vide, which means “under vacuum” in French, refers to the process of vacuum-sealing food in a bag, then cooking it to a very precise temperature in a water bath. This technique produces results that are impossible to achieve through any other cooking method.

Sous vide cooking is much easier than you might think, and usually involved three simple steps:

1. Attach your precision cooker to a pot of water and set the time and temperature according to your desired level of doneness.

2. Put your food in a sealable bag and clip it to the side of the pot.

3. Finish by searing, grilling, or broiling the food to add a crispy, golden exterior layer.

Sous vide cooking utilizes precise temperature control with circulation to produce results that you can’t achieve through any other cooking technique. The reason–when using traditional methods of cooking, you don’t have control over heat and temperature. Consequently, it’s very difficult and time consuming to consistently cook great food. Food ends up overcooked on the outside, with only a small portion in the center that is cooked to the temperature you want. Food loses flavor, overcooks easily, and ends up with a dry, chewy texture.

With precise temperature control in the kitchen, sous vide provides the following benefits:

Consistency. Because you cook your food to a precise temperature for a precise amount of time, you can expect very consistent results.

Taste. Food cooks in its juices. This ensures that the food is moist, juicy and tender.

Waste reduction. Traditionally prepared food dries out and results in waste. For example, on average, traditionally cooked steak loses up to 40% of its volume due to drying out. Steak cooked via precision cooking, loses none of its volume.

Flexibility. Traditional cooking can require your constant attention. Precision cooking brings food to an exact temperature and holds it. There is no worry about overcooking.

entry.title: Eye of round Steaks "Tournedos" Australian Wagyu MB 5-7
entry.summary:
Vendor: Slipacoff's Premium Meats
Type: Steak
Price: 10.95 - 14.95 (2 variants)

Right from the Outback, This is next level cross breed Wagyu from Andrews Tajima. Full blood sire and Angus Dam. Graded 5-7 these Australian Wagyu Tournedos are so well marbled, never mind the olive oil or butter to sear them. It will do so on its own .

They will blow you away. Very hard to find something else to beat other than A5 Japanese Kobe for more than double the price. Smoking this piece is for the ELITE. 

Serious players ONLY!

Beware highly addictive. 

  • Australian wagyu beef (MB Grade 5-7)
  • Halal approved
  • Hormone Free

Awesome when grilled, cast iron seared or broiled if desired.

entry.title: Baseball AAA (Bacon Wrapped Packed in 2's)
entry.summary:
Vendor: Slipacoff's Premium Meats
Type: Steak
Price: 23.95 - 26.95 (2 variants)

Nicknamed the "Baseball thick Cut." Our center cut bacon wrapped Top Sirloin steaks are cut from Canadian-raised AAA beef that's aged for a minimum of 35 days and totally free of hormones or antibiotics.

These are a true center cut steaks, completely denuded before portioning. Exclusively here at Slipacoff's Premium Meats as you won't find these in any store. Grilled, cast iron seared or even broiled.

Once you try it, it will always find it's way into your next order with us. 


  • 100% AAA Canadian beef Top Sirloin
  • Naturally raised
  • Free from hormones and antibiotics

entry.title: Striploin Steak AAA Center Cut
entry.summary:
Vendor: Slipacoff's Premium Meats
Type: Steak
Price: 9.00 - 21.95 (4 variants)

One of our most popular cuts, The Striploin Steak is hand-selected AAA graded beef. We age our Striploins for more than 35 days.

Also know as New York Strip, This cut from the loin is one of the three most popular and flavorful steaks you can buy, alongside tenderloin and ribeye. Striploin doesn't have the fat content you might find in a rib steak or ribeye, so if you are looking for something on the leaner side, but still a premium cut of beef, this cut is the way to go.

We recommend the grill or cast iron searing for best results. Simple and easy !

 

  • 100% AAA Canadian beef 
  • Local & Naturally raised
  • Free from hormones and antibiotics
